metadata.title: CVE-2019-11699 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A malicious page can briefly cause the wrong name to be highlighted as thedomain name in the addressbar during page navigations. This could result inuser confusion of which site is currently loaded for spoofing attacks. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 67.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11699` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
